userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: I take Gabenpentin.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Keep moving. Don't give into the pain. Learn to pray / mediate or talk yourself through the pain

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Get a neuro doctor that has experience in Trigeminal . Also join the online support group

condition.description:
Trigeminal neuralgia (TN) is a type of chronic pain that affects your face. It causes extreme, sudden burning or shock-like pain. It usually affects one side of the face. Any vibration on your face, even from talking, can set it off. The condition may come and go, disappearing for days or even months. But the longer you have it, the less often it goes away.

TN usually affects people over 50, especially women. The cause is probably a blood vessel pressing on the trigeminal nerve, one of the largest nerves in the head. Tumors and multiple sclerosis can also cause TN, but in some cases the cause is unknown.

There is no single test to diagnose TN. It can be hard to diagnose, since many other conditions can cause facial pain. Treatment options include medicines, surgery, and complementary techniques.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Trigeminal neuralgia

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Tegretol is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to block certain kinds of nerve activity to reduce seizures and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Tegretol is useful for preventing seizures and relieving certain types of nerve pain, but interacts with many drugs.
downsides: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents seizures, stabilizes mood, and relieves nerve pain.

userStories.tip: How dependent I am on it. The pain is terrifying .

If the medicine is causing a rash, there are many topical steroids that will keep it under control- or vanquish it completely. I get the rash on my face- so when my doc prescribed fluocinolone, it oil changed my life.
make it part of your beauty routine etc so that you won't forget to take it. Always make sure you have enough and if on holiday, be sure to take a prescription along

drugs.name: Tegretol

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to low sodium
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

points.hlt: upper respiratory tract signs and symptoms

points.name: Twitching
points.hlt: muscle related signs and symptoms nec

carousel_items: Avoid activities requiring mental alertness (like driving) until you know how it affects you.
Can cause extreme drowsiness or dizziness if you're taking it with high blood pressure medications.
Side effects are more prevalent in the elderly.
Don't drink alcohol while using this.
Can be taken as needed or 'around-the-clock'. Ask your doctor about what'll work best for you.
If taking regularly, you need to work with your doctor to get off the medication slowly (also called tapering) to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Baclofen is a muscle relaxer. It works in the nervous system to calm down muscle spasms without interfering with normal muscle function.
basics.bottom_line: Baclofen is effective for long term spastic conditions, such as multiple sclerosis, spinal cord injury, and others.
downsides: If taking regularly, you shouldn't stop taking Baclofen abruptly. You'll need to get off of it slowly.
Be careful if taking other drugs that affect your ability to stay awake, since Baclofen can make you much more tired.

downsides_processed.orig: If taking regularly, you shouldn't stop taking Baclofen abruptly. You'll need to get off of it slowly.
Be careful if taking other drugs that affect your ability to stay awake, since Baclofen can make you much more tired.

upsides: Baclofen is effective for treating muscle spasms, as well as being an effective muscle relaxant.
Relieves pain associated with muscle spasms.
A better option for seniors compared to other muscle relaxants since it has less side effects than the other meds.
Baclofen is available as a generic and is a relatively inexpensive medication.

upsides_processed.orig: Baclofen is effective for treating muscle spasms, as well as being an effective muscle relaxant.
Relieves pain associated with muscle spasms.
A better option for seniors compared to other muscle relaxants since it has less side effects than the other meds.
Baclofen is available as a generic and is a relatively inexpensive medication.

userStories.tip: Not a very helpful or safe drug

Good for muscle aches from withdrawal but no other improvements from opiate withdrawal. Worked really well for muscle cramps and pain though. Not help with insomnia.  I'm writing this review at 2:00am because I can't sleep.

drugs.name: baclofen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Avoid activities requiring mental alertness (like driving) until you know how it affects you.
Can cause extreme drowsiness or dizziness if you're taking it with high blood pressure medications.
Side effects are more prevalent in the elderly.
Don't drink alcohol while using this.
Can be taken as needed or 'around-the-clock'. Ask your doctor about what'll work best for you.
If taking regularly, you need to work with your doctor to get off the medication slowly (also called tapering) to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle spasms and break down
risks_warnings.description: If taking the drug consistently, avoid stopping the drug abruptly. Stopping it too fast can cause serious muscle problems, sometimes even leading to organ failure. Risk is higher in patients with spinal injuries at T-6 or higher.

description_processed.orig: If taking the drug consistently, avoid stopping the drug abruptly. Stopping it too fast can cause serious muscle problems, sometimes even leading to organ failure. Risk is higher in patients with spinal injuries at T-6 or higher.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Baclofen lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Baclofen lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Baclofen can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.
risk_factors: Using other medicines that can cause seizures

description_processed.orig: Baclofen can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

carousel_items: Follow dose adjustments set by your doctor to minimize skin rash.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Report rash, blurry vision, fever, persistent headache, or neck stiffness to your doctor.
Makes hormonal birth control less effective.
Takes 4 to 6 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Lamictal is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to calm nerve activity in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Lamictal is most useful for treating severe seizure disorders, and for bipolar disorder with more depression symptoms than manic symptoms. Just be careful to increase your dose slowly to avoid skin rash.
downsides: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

upsides: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.

userStories.tip: At 200mg, I developed some really nasty forehead acne and my skin was extremely oily, even with cleaning 2x/day and retin-a. I finally saw a dermatologist who mentioned he's had patients suffer from lamictal-induced acne...not just a rash.

Weirdest/best side effect from any medicine goes to Lamictal - for the first couple weeks I had really intense and vivid movie-like dreams. It gives me horrible headaches but I take it before bed so I sleep through it.
It saved my life...but titrate slowly. Too high = what I call "woo woo's"; cerebral palsy-like symptoms (full body jerks, almost seizure like but fully aware & able to communicate).
Need to monitor for liver toxicity
Blurred vision, uncontrolled muscle jerks, shaking
Double Vision is really a hassle comes and goes. Tremors, have an unexpected jerk in my hand. Have knocked things over and off the stand, but helps control my anger.

The generic versions do not work. I found out the hard way - I was switched to the generic and ended up with a very bad depression. Things turned around once the insurance co approved the brand name. It is pricey.

userStories.identifier: Woman with PTSD and Bipolar II disorder
userStories.tip: Has changed my life in evening out my mood- no hypo mania but kind of miss feeling more motivated. Have trouble initiating and have to take a lot of countering supplements to deal with fuzzy brain. Worsening soluble vision is a problem.
Doctors don't tell you it causes double vision. Also can cause fuzzy thinking at higher doses- sometimes called "Lamictal Stupid."

stick with it for a little more time b4 you count it out /don't play with doses! it took at least 6mnths (after months of figuring out and getting up to right dose with my dr) for me to realize how much less severe & freqnt episodes were!
Take it slow. Don't expect overnight changes.
supresses libido at 75 mg

I feel great on lamotrigine. Other seizure drugs depressed me.
But... not all manufacturers' pills are the same. My pharmacist must give me pills from the same generic company. Glaxo-SK's Lamictal is one of the worst for me.
Splitting up dosages in the morning and evening helps with "smoothening" out the side effects such as dizziness. Definitely take the branded XR version. Generic Lamotrigine was horrible for me.

I was on Serezone for 10 years and stopped working. I augmented with Lamictal and it made a world of difference. I have a lot more energy and my outlook has changed.  As of 2 months ago, I am no longer on Serezone, just Lamictal. It is great
userStories.identifier: Active, in great shape, feel like 40

userStories.tip: Lamictal saved my life. However some of the side effects are annoying such as neck pain,problems with co-ordination, ( have had a few very bad falls) judging distances  ( parking is a nightmare) and some  minor.skin problems. Overall the side effects are worth it to me. My moods are very stable. Very rarely depressed or hypomanic. Life is good.
take it twice a day... the effects do not last for 24 hours and taking it twice a day evens out your experience.
Extended release version seems to have fewer side effects than immediate-release.  Best to take in a.m.

userStories.identifier: Someone who has struggled with dysthymia
userStories.tip: It took a little tinkering to find the dosage that worked best for me.

Must titer up and down slowly... comes in 50mg and 100mg intervals so you can gradually adjust the dosage until you get it right. I take between 200mg and 300mg. It's the only medication that has consistently controlled my mood swings.
this is the first medication that worked for both seizures and bipolar disorder. seriously a life saver.

I have a pretty atypical case of bipolar, but the lamictal really cuts down on the irritability. When I'm in the depths of my depression or super manic, I'm actually pleasant to be around and don't take everything super personally.

Worked wonders for mood stability, best ever.  Do not miss a dose or you will go through nasty withdrawal! Have immunoglobulin levels checked before starting & monitored, as it can cause an immune deficiency.
Double vision went away when I started taking Lamictal Xr instead of the regular type. Haven't experienced any other side effects.
It saved my life.
Really I don't fell any hassle, even when I left for some time, the only thing that happened is my mood didn't go very well.
Take it around the same time every day. I have to take mine in the morning and at night. Also taking it with food helps curb nausea & any possible drowsiness.
if you forget to take it for a day or two you'll be okay but youll begin to feel it, life saver

userStories.identifier: A semi-retired writer; used to be pharma
userStories.tip: I take it every 12 hours. Insomnia was a problem for a month or so; I adapted. A problem is manufacturer difference. Some cause seizures (dose too high), so I stick with one and need to check its ID every time I pick up a bottle.

drugs.name: Lamictal

carousel_items_processed.orig: Follow dose adjustments set by your doctor to minimize skin rash.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Report rash, blurry vision, fever, persistent headache, or neck stiffness to your doctor.
Makes hormonal birth control less effective.
Takes 4 to 6 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Meningitis
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Interactions with birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. This can be dangerous. Talk to your doctor if you're taking birth control pills, or if you're thinking about starting or stopping them.

description_processed.orig: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. This can be dangerous. Talk to your doctor if you're taking birth control pills, or if you're thinking about starting or stopping them.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lamictal suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Lamictal, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lamictal suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Lamictal, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Keep moving. Don't give into the pain. Learn to pray / mediate or talk yourself through the pain

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Get a neuro doctor that has experience in Trigeminal . Also join the online support group
